title: Allow partners to view each other's journal entries

requirements.summary: Add a React Query hook to fetch the partner's journal entries from the backend
acceptanceCriteria: A useQuery hook exists that fetches partner journal entries.
The hook is only active when the user is in a coupled state.
Loading and error states are handled.

file_operations.description: Add a useGetPartnerJournals hook that calls the backend getPartnerJournals method, following the same pattern as useGetPartnerDailyPlannerEntries. The hook should be enabled only when the user has a partner (couple state exists). It returns all four journal types (daily, emotional, night reflection, growth) in a single query. Include proper loading and error state handling using TanStack Query.

requirements.summary: Add a read-only partner journal view tab in JournalSection that displays the partner's journal entries across all four journal types
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Partner's Journal' tab or toggle appears in JournalSection only when the user is linked to a partner.
All four journal types are viewable in read-only mode from the partner's perspective.
No edit or save controls are shown in the partner view.
Date navigation works in the partner view to browse different entries.
The partner view is visually consistent with other partner view tabs in the app.

file_operations.description: Add a read-only partner journal view following the established pattern from DailyPlanner, WeeklyPlanner, MonthlyPlanner, and VisionBoard. Add a view mode toggle or tab that switches between 'My Journal' and 'Partner's Journal' (visible only when in a couple). When in partner view mode, fetch journal entries using the new useGetPartnerJournals hook and display all four journal types (daily, emotional, night reflection, growth) in read-only cards or sections. Hide all save/edit buttons in partner view. Ensure date navigation works to browse partner entries by date. Use consistent styling with the existing partner view pattern, including the couple mode badge or visual indicator. Filter partner entries by the currently selected date to show only relevant entries.
